department: Public Works and Government Services Canada
short_summary: replace existing bridge with new concrete and steel bridge
description: The government of Canada is looking to replace an existing bridge with a new concrete and steel bridge. The new bridge will be built in Grasslands National Park in the province of Saskatchewan. The project will include the maintenance of an existing temporary detour, construction of new concrete and steel bridge, re-alignment of the gravel grid road, demolition and environmentally friendly disposal of the existing timber bridge and road access, and site restoration.BIDS RECEIVED BY FAX AND EMAIL WILL BE ACCEPTED AS OFFICIAL. Parks Canada is not currently accepting bids via SAP Ariba, you must submit your bid VIA FAX OR EMAIL AS INDICATED IN THE SOLICITATION DOCUMENT.
full_summary:
**Walker Bridge Replacement, Grasslands National Park**

**Notice Type:** Invitation to Qualify for Stage 1 - Competitive Open Bidding

**Reference Number:** PW-23-01030923

**Tender Closing Date:** Wednesday, April 12, 2023, at 4:00 PM CST

**Contracting Entity:** Parks Canada
**Contracting Entity Address:** 30 Victoria Street, Gatineau, Quebec J8X 0B3, Canada

**Tender Description:**
Parks Canada invites qualified contractors to submit bids for Stage 1 - Walker Bridge Replacement, Grasslands National Park. The tender includes the maintenance of an existing temporary detour, construction of a new concrete and steel short-span bridge, re-alignment of the gravel grid road, demolition and environmentally friendly disposal of the existing timber bridge and road access, and site restoration.

**Information and Requirements:**
The Walker Bridge is located near a working ranch. Interested bidders should download the tender documents from the Government of Canada's tendering service (GC Bid). The estimated contract value is between $1,000,001 and $5,000,000, including taxes.

**Tender Requirements:**
Parks Canada reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers. All work must comply with the National Park Act and regulations.

**Bidders' Conference:**
A bidders' conference will be held via teleconference on April 3, 2023, at 1:30 PM CST in Microsoft Teams. It is recommended that bidders attend or send a representative.

**Enquiries and Tender Documents:**
Enquiries are to be submitted in writing to the contracting authority. Tender documents are available in French and English and may be downloaded from the Government of Canada's tendering service (GC Bid).

**Important Notes:**
LATE SUBMISSIONS WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED
IF YOU NEED TO CHANGE THE ORIGINAL ELECTRONIC SUBMISSION YOU SHOULD CONTACT PROCUREMENT STAFF AT  Ottawa at  NATIONAL PARKS REGULATIONS REQUIRE ALL WORK TO BE COMPIED WITH ORDINANCES, LAWS, RULES AND REGULATIONS SET OUT IN THE NATIONAL PARK ACT.
GOVERNMENT OF CANADA TENDERING SERVICE
